text: Ghana competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Ghana entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Jason Arthur |align=left|50 m backstroke |26.84 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m backstroke |56.86 |45 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Abeiku Jackson |align=left|50 m butterfly |24.85 |50 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |54.94 |47 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Kaya Forson |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:00.29 |66 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:34.59 |36 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Zaira Forson |align=left|200 m freestyle |2:18.74 |56 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m butterfly |2:39.20 |33 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Mixed {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan=2|Athlete !rowspan=2|Event !colspan=2|Heat !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left|Jason Arthur Kaya Forson Abeiku Jackson Zaira Forson |align=left|4×100 m medley relay |4:21.40 |31 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Ghana at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Ghana at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
